timeline.subject: Dieudonne veuve Jean Bache
timeline.details: Complaint against Jean Gerardin by Dieudonne veuve Jean Bache for assault with fleau and attack at poisle

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Substitut notes complaints about Gerardin's behavior, asks Prevot to investigate

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Informations taken by Prevot, suspicions of witchcraft noted

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Procureur General des Vosges orders arrest of Gerardin

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: First interrogation - denied witchcraft, admitted various assaults and sexual offenses

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Separate deposition by Bastien Lalemant taken at home due to illness

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: PG des Vosges asks for ordinary and extraordinary torture

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture with moderation clause

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - briefly confessed then retracted, maintained he was not a witch

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Post-torture interrogation - continued to deny witchcraft but admitted to being a 'paillard'

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: PG des Vosges recommends hanging for sexual and violent crimes though not convicted of witchcraft

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Change de Nancy opts for pillory, whipping, perpetual banishment, shoulder marking, and confiscation

timeline.subject: Jean Gerardin
timeline.details: Prevot of Bruyeres and local judges sentence to death by majority; sentence carried out

torture.restrictions: observans la mediocrité requise et convenable a Justice

prior_accusations.context: General reputation as witch spanning 10-12 years; ancestors (devanciers) also suspected

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Jean Ferry
notable_quotes.french: Pour le sortilege a dit que les devanciers dudit Gerardin et luy, en ont tousiours este noté et soubconné
notable_quotes.english: For witchcraft, said that the ancestors of said Gerardin and he himself have always been noted and suspected
notable_quotes.context: Testimony about family reputation for witchcraft

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: elle ne mouroit d'autres mains que des siennes
notable_quotes.english: she would die by no other hands than his
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Jannon after raping her

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: de luy garder un bon plaisir s'il vivoit sept ans
notable_quotes.english: to save him a good pleasure if he lived seven years

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Ozelle
notable_quotes.french: il n y avoit a son dire fille ny femme de bien que celles qui se laissoient nicher de luy, qu'il estoit un calomniateur ordinaire, et que sa cruche iroit tant a l'eaue qu'elle bucqueroit et se romproit
notable_quotes.english: there was no good girl or woman except those who let themselves be bedded by him, that he was a habitual slanderer, and that his jug would go to the water so often it would stumble and break
notable_quotes.context: Ozelle's retort to Gerardin in cemetery dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin under torture
notable_quotes.french: rigueurs luy feroient bien confesser, et accuser ses pere et mere
notable_quotes.english: the rigors would make him confess and accuse his father and mother
notable_quotes.context: Warning that torture would force false confession

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: a l'esgard du sortilege que plusieurs l'accusent, il a intention a sa mort de les adjourner a comparoir au bout de l'an par devant le grand juge, qui scaura discerner le vray du faulx
notable_quotes.english: regarding the witchcraft of which several accuse him, he intends at his death to summon them to appear at year's end before the great judge, who will know how to discern truth from falsehood

notable_quotes.speaker: Procureur General des Vosges
notable_quotes.french: estant ainsy du tout debordé, abandonné et lasché a ses voluptés paillardises et lubricités stupres et adulteres avec plusieurs grands scandalz
notable_quotes.english: being thus completely debauched, abandoned and given over to his voluptuous lusts and lubricities, rapes and adulteries with many great scandals

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Gerardin
notable_quotes.french: que sadite femme est bien cause de ce qu'il s'est ainsi amusé aux putaines, pour ne luy avoir voulu souvent rendre le devoir de mariage
notable_quotes.english: that his said wife is very much the cause of him thus amusing himself with whores, for often not wanting to render him the marital duty
notable_quotes.context: Gerardin blaming his wife for his sexual crimes

relationships.evidence_text: Was married to Marguerite, daughter of widow called La Grande Marye living at Grandviller
Bastien Gerardin, his father, who had also been suspected of witchcraft
daughter of widow called La Grande Marye living at Grandviller
was angry because Ozelle was his son-in-law
After her father, Jean Clanchier, had quarrelled with Gerardin
when she was living with her father Thomas Jean Bergier in Dompierre
his brother had bought a horse from Gerardin's brother Demenge
heard of Gerardin's attack on his father
His father Demenge Coley had died 7 years earlier
Had seen first attack on mother
when Marguerite talked to her sister Mongeote about her husband's bad conduct
prevented from raping her by presence of her brother

economic_context.details: Gerardin attacked Antoine Toussaint because he had deceived him about prospects of his wife, pretending she had more property than was the case. Multiple disputes over sales and transactions: refused sale of horse, pig sales, payment for carting hay. Gerardin had served as soldier in Germany for 20+ years, now worked in agriculture (labourage). Property confiscation mentioned in final sentence.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Assault with fleau, punched in face, dragged by hair, torn clothes
death of horse
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to sell him a horse

harms_catalog.harm_description: death of cow being fattened
struck from behind with handle of hoe, head injury so severe he might have died, remained ill for long time
attacked with hoe on leaving church

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Jean Vaulthier (daughter of witness 5)
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill, remained sick for 6 months, constantly claimed sickness given by Gerardin, sometimes claimed he was in room pointing to him but others saw nothing
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: various quarrels with Jean Vaulthier who was Gerardin's neighbor, wife became involved, various threats

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse owned by Nicolas Claudon Petit Homme and father

harms_catalog.harm_description: two pigs became sick on way to market, had to accept very low price
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: bargained to buy pig but couldn't agree price
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: two days (Wednesday bargaining failed, Thursday Gerardin visited pigs and touched them, Friday they became sick)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Gerardin and wife passed hands over backs of two which fell ill

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill after putting on camisole, could not move limbs, eat or drink, remained in this state for 3 months
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel 7-8 years earlier, Gerardin called him 'larron' and 'meschant homme', threw stones, threatened 'de luy garder un bon plaisir s'il vivoit sept ans'
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: shortly after quarrel when he took cloth to tailor; Gerardin touched it saying 'voila du bon drap'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Gerardin chased her until she sought refuge in another house, was ill for a year 'sentant quelque chose qui se promenoit parmy son corps', then died
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: ill for a year then died

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness 9 years before which forced him to go on crutches
similar illness
similar illness
fallen into fire and been badly burned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: her father Jean Clanchier had quarrelled with Gerardin

harms_catalog.harm_description: illness and death; became much worse after Gerardin gave her 'patenees cuites a sec'
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after being given food by Gerardin

harms_catalog.harm_description: struck on legs with white stick by Bastien Gerardin (father of accused), was ill for long time, recovered after father threatened to have Bastien imprisoned
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: boy called Jean Gerardin 'fils de sorcier'

harms_catalog.harm_description: raped with broken arm in sling, later beaten so badly spent fortnight in bed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she told Nicolas de Sercoeur about the rape
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: when Gerardin learned she had told someone

harms_catalog.harm_description: sickened and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Gerardin angry about brother selling horse without consulting him, came and reproached witness uttering threats, witness called him witch and threatened to stab him

harms_catalog.harm_description: death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Gerardin threatened him because he reproached Gerardin for pursuing an unmarried daughter, when couldn't have the girl he defamed her

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill on return home and died in 8 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with Gerardin after damage done by cattle, seemed settled
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: soon after Gerardin picked up boy in village and asked whose son he was

historical_context.military_details: Gerardin served as soldier in Germany for 20+ years. Witness Demenge Antoine Toussaint had been with troops of Messieurs Bauffremonts and de Tremblecourt 'au veage de Bourgogne' 19 years earlier. Military references and weapons (carabine, swords) feature in testimony.
economic_hardship_indicators: Jannon forced to take job guarding cattle to support herself after breaking arm
Jannon married 'homme de peu' who left her little when he died
dispute over property in marriage arrangements
economic value of animals features prominently in disputes
religious_calendar_references: St. Sacrement (Corpus Christi) 1613 - date of assault on Claudon Ozelle
Whitsun - approximate time of rape of Jannon

officials_named.name: substitut of Procureur General des Vosges

prior_legal_disputes.description: Paid fines for assault on Antoine Toussaint 24 years earlier

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Change de Nancy opted for pillory, whipping, perpetual banishment, shoulder marking, and confiscation instead of death penalty recommended by PG

hearsay_chains.content: that Gerardin had threatened his father before death
that Marguerite's sister Mongeote reproached her about aiding husband's attempt to debauch Claudate

emotional_state_notes: cried out and begged during torture not to be tempted into perjury
admitted to being 'ung grand putassier' (great whoremonger)
willing to die for other crimes but insisted not a witch
blamed wife for his sexual crimes

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: accused Jean Clanchier of having to common knowledge lived with his niece and made her pregnant
claimed Jannel had been willing partner, had been with 'quelque seigneur', continued relationship after marriage
claimed Jennon wife of Nicolas Goery offered him beans and peas, found him in hedge, he begged pardon because he feared Nicolas who was rich and powerful
insisted Claudate had encouraged him, allowed 'tant d'attouchements impudiques', it was no fault of hers they didn't complete the act

extraction_metadata.notes: This is an unusual case where the accused was tried for witchcraft but ultimately executed for sexual violence and assault rather than witchcraft. Despite widespread reputation for witchcraft spanning 10-12 years and involving his ancestors, Gerardin denied witchcraft throughout, even under torture. He briefly confessed under extreme torture but immediately retracted. The trial reveals extensive pattern of sexual violence (multiple rapes, attempted rapes, sexual harassment), physical assaults with weapons, and threatening behavior. Final sentence came from local judges who overruled the Change de Nancy's recommendation for banishment and instead imposed death penalty. Case demonstrates intersection of witchcraft accusations with sexual violence and community conflict.
